question: The best way to understand other cultures is to work for a multinational organisation? Agree or Disagree
text: Working for a multinational is thought by many to be the most effective way to learn about different cultures.  Thesis Statement: Although Working for such a company provides the opportunity to mix with people from a variety of cultural backgrounds, I would argue that this is not necessarily the best way to learn about other cultures.

There is no doubt that for some people, working for a multinational organisation will enhance their understanding of other cultures. The first reason is that in a multinational organisation one can learn about the customs and traditions of other countries, though mixing with people from different backgrounds who work in the company or liaising with colleagues abroad. Showing to other languages is also likely, something that gives a much greater depth of understanding of a culture. There may also be the chance to relocate to work in another country, which would mean complete immersion in that culture.

However, there are a number of reasons that it is not necessarily the best way. Firstly, there is no guarantee that you will be a person who gets such exposure to other cultures since it depends on your position within the company.  Not all employees have roles where they regularly mix with other cultures. Also, there are also other excellent ways to achieve such a goal. For example, many people these days travel the world, and this is an opportunity to meet and spend time with people from other countries. It is possible to do voluntary work with organisations and charities that work in other countries, something that would mean you meet a mix of people rather than just those works in companies.

In conclusion, despite the potential way in which working for a multinational company can result in contact with people from other cultures, i believe that it cannot be assumed it is the best way as there are other options to do this.
